title: Sona BLW shares rise over 3% on JV with China's JNT to develop driveline systems
content: Auto component maker Sona BLW Precision Forgings Ltd. (Sona Comstar) rallied by over 3 percent to Rs 496.5 in morning trade on July 21 after a new joint venture in China. The company has partnered with Hubei-based Jinnaite Machinery Co. Ltd. (JNT) to manufacture and supply driveline systems for automotive OEMs in China and global markets. The joint venture, which is expected to become operational in the second half of FY26, will cater to both electric and internal combustion engine vehicle platforms. Sona Comstar will invest $12 million for a 60 percent stake and retain controlling interest, while JNT will hold the remaining 40 percent by bringing in $8 million worth of assets and operational business. Follow our LIVE Blog for all the latest market updates While Sona Comstar will steer the venture strategically, JNT will manage the day-to-day operations. The collaboration is designed to marry Sona Comstar’s expertise in precision engineering with JNT’s advanced manufacturing capabilities and strong foothold in the Chinese market. "This partnership marks an important step in our efforts to deepen our reach in high-growth Asian markets," said Vivek Vikram Singh, Managing Director & Group CEO of Sona Comstar. Also read: New CEOs are driving stock surge across India Inc with a 75 percent success rate JNT operates a modern foundry backed by patented technology and serves a wide range of sectors including automotive, aviation, railway, and marine. Its client base spans across China, North America, Europe, and Japan. The board of Sona Comstar has cleared the binding term sheet and authorised company executives to formalise the shareholder agreement and related documentation for the JV. At about 9:55 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 490, higher by 2.2 percent from the last close on the NSE. Sona BLW shares are down 18 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Laxmi Dental shares surge 4% as six-month shareholder lock-in ends
content: Shares of Laxmi Dental Ltd rallied 4 percent to Rs 502.75 per share on Monday, July 21, as the six-month lock-in period for certain pre-IPO shareholders ended today, freeing up a significant chunk of equity for potential trade. According to analysis by Nuvama Alternative & Quantitative Research, nearly 2.06 crore shares—or about 37 percent of the company’s outstanding equity—are set to become eligible for trading following the expiry of the lock-in. While these shares can now be sold in the open market, it does not necessarily mean that they will be, as the decision ultimately lies with the shareholders. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates As of the March quarter, promoters held a 41.7 percent stake in the dental products company, with the remainder distributed among institutional and retail investors. Mutual funds owned 11.89 percent, with names like HSBC MF, HDFC MF, and Invesco MF among the key holders. Investor sentiment around the stock has been upbeat lately. Brokerage Motilal Oswal initiated coverage on Laxmi Dental last week with a ‘buy’ rating, pegging a base-case upside of 26 percent. Also read: UltraTech Cement Q1 preview: Net profit, revenue seen rising on volume growth, pricing uptick In its bullish scenario, the firm projected the stock could climb to Rs 750, implying gains of up to 75 percent from current levels. Following the bullish call from the domestic brokerage, the stock rallied 12 percent during the week, pushing it above its IPO issue price of Rs 428 per share. At about 9:20 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 498.3, higher by 3.3 percent from the last close on the NSE. Laxmi Dental shares have rallied over 17 percent in the last month. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Wipro share price falls 2.02% in early trade
content: Shares of Wipro declined by 2.02% to Rs 261.55 in early trade on Monday. The stock's movement reflects a notable shift in investor sentiment, with the current price showing a decrease from its previous close. At 09:22 am, the stock is trading on the Nifty 50. According to Moneycontrol analysis as of July 14, 2025, investor sentiment toward the stock is very bearish. Financial Performance: The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Wipro:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 21,963.80 CroreRs 22,301.60 CroreRs 22,318.80 CroreRs 22,504.20 CroreRs 22,134.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,041.10 CroreRs 3,226.30 CroreRs 3,366.20 CroreRs 3,559.00 CroreRs 3,331.50 CroreEPS5.756.143.213.413.18The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 22,134.60 Crore, slightly down from Rs 22,504.20 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,331.50 Crore, compared to Rs 3,559.00 Crore in the previous quarter. Earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3.18, while it was Rs 3.41 for the quarter-ending March 2025. The following table summarizes the consolidated yearly financial performance of Wipro:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 61,934.90 CroreRs 79,312.00 CroreRs 90,487.60 CroreRs 89,760.30 CroreRs 89,088.40 CroreNet ProfitRs 10,855.00 CroreRs 12,237.70 CroreRs 11,372.20 CroreRs 11,135.40 CroreRs 13,192.60 CroreEPS19.1122.3720.7320.8912.56BVPS100.48119.40141.63142.6578.65ROE19.6618.6914.6114.8115.94Debt to Equity0.120.230.190.190.20The revenue for the year-ending 2025 was Rs 89,088.40 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 89,760.30 Crore in the year-ending 2024. Net profit for the year-ending 2025 was Rs 13,192.60 Crore, an increase from Rs 11,135.40 Crore in the year-ending 2024. The company’s Earnings Per Share (EPS) stood at Rs 12.56 for the year-ending March 2025, and the book value per share was Rs 78.65. The return on equity (ROE) was 15.94 percent, and the debt-to-equity ratio was 0.20 as of the year-ending March 2025. The income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 89,088 Crore, other income of Rs 3,884 Crore, and total income of Rs 92,972 Crore. Total expenditure amounted to Rs 74,025 Crore, resulting in earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) of Rs 18,947 Crore. After accounting for interest of Rs 1,477 Crore and taxes of Rs 4,277 Crore, the net profit was Rs 13,192 Crore. Corporate Actions: Wipro has announced several corporate actions, including the transcript of the Analyst/ Institutional Investor Meeting held on July 17, 2025. The audio recording is available on Wipro's website. Additionally, a newspaper advertisement was published regarding Regulation 47 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. The presentation and video recording of the earnings press conference held on July 17, 2025, are also available on the company's website. The company announced an interim dividend of Rs 5.00 per share (250%) on July 17, 2025, with an effective date of July 28, 2025. Another interim dividend of Rs 6.00 per share (300%) was announced on January 17, 2025, effective January 28, 2025. Wipro issued a bonus share with existing ratio of 1:1, announcement date was on October 17, 2024 and exbonus date was on December 03, 2024. The stock split was announced on April 30, 1999, with old face value of Rs 10 and new face value of Rs 2, and exsplit date on September 27, 1999. In summary, Wipro's early trading today shows a price decrease, with investors reacting to recent financial announcements and market conditions.
